key_points: New Mexico judge orders assistant director Dave Halls to be interviewed by state workplace safety regulators.
Halls handed Alec Baldwin the prop gun that resulted in cinematographer Halyna Hutchins' death.
The incident occurred on October 21 on the Bonanza Creek Ranch film set near Santa Fe.
The Occupational Health and Safety Bureau of the state Environment Department issued the subpoena.
Halls had declined two previous requests for an interview, citing the ongoing criminal investigation.
The interview is considered crucial due to Halls' role in set safety and his handling of the gun.
District Judge Bryan Biedscheid granted the subpoena request on Friday.
Assistant director Halls' attorney has not responded to requests for comment but reported to cooperate with the investigation.
Rebecca Roose, deputy cabinet secretary of the Environment Department, highlighted the importance of Halls' testimony.
Alec Baldwin claimed he was unaware the gun contained a live round, emphasizing the need to identify who loaded the weapon.
spokespersons: Rebecca Roose (Deputy Cabinet Secretary, Environment Department)
